result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan A Larriuz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $500.00 including all mandatory costs to be paid from bail on deposit.

Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of the sentence, no new violations of the law and restitution paid in full on case 12CF4692.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence. Huber to apply for work and treatment and child care.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan A Larriuz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Juan A Larriuz in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve four months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 1 day time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and treatment and child care.Court stayed  the commencment until  5-18-15.

Fine of $500.00   including  all mandatory costs to be paid from bail on deposit.

Court will grant expungment upon successful completion of the sentence, no new violations of the law and restitution paid in full on case 12cf4692.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Juan A Larriuz in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-07-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Juan A Larriuz in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
    Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 02-25-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Juan A Larriuz in court.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape#15-012
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 47 for a Pretrial Conference.

Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/20/15 @ 1:30 pm
